reviews.text: Harrah's Reno is becoming my favorite Harrah's destination due to its outstanding and friendly customer service. Our hotel stay was perfect, we could not have asked for better accomodations.
reviews.title: We had a great stay at Harrah's Reno!

likes.liked: — The service at Harrah's Reno is outstanding, very friendly and accomodating staff.
likes.disliked: — We are not fancy eaters; however, was surprised the Noodle Bar closed by 9:00 PM.

reviews.text: I've written a trip report on the Reno forum, here is the link:
reviews.title: Harrah's was fine

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: http://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowTopic-g45992-i246-k2058303-TR_June_12_14_Harrah_s_Reno-Reno_Nevada.html
reviews.title: Nice enough

reviews.text: We had a great stay at Harrah's, this was our second stay at this hotel. Our first visit was in December, after our stay we were contacted by a property host who booked this trip for us. I highly recommend using a host for booking a hotel stay at Harrah's. We were able to get a suite due to our midweek stay; even so, using a host is very worthwhile as they can comp rooms and upgrade you if you have a Harrah's Total Rewards card.
reviews.title: typical downtown casino hotel

reviews.text: We stayed at Harrah's for a week in March while my husband was in Reno on business. We got a great rate on the internet; otherwise, I probably wouldn't have been that thrilled. Their rack rate is a little high.
reviews.title: Typical Harrahs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just got back from a 3 night stay at Harrah's Reno from April 13th - 16th and I must say, it is the friendliest place I have ever stayed at. From the people at check-in to the servers in the casino and the housekeeping staff, everyone was amazing! I can't say enough about all of them!
reviews.title: Friendliest place around

likes.disliked: — Cold air conditioning in the casino

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was lovely as well, it was in the west wing on the 6th floor and had been renovated. The bed wasn't too bad for comfort however, we still have a motionless water bed so have a hard time getting used to anything else anywhere anyway.
reviews.title: Always Good

reviews.text: The breakfast buffet at the hotel's restaurant, Carvings, was amazing and the price reasonable for the selection. They even offer steak which was so tender and full of flavour. It was everything you could ever want.
reviews.title: Loved the Harrahs, even thought I lost...

reviews.text: We didn't find too much happening in downtown Reno however, we enjoyed the casino at Harrah's even though some of the machines were "tight" but my husband enjoyed himself at the $5.00 blackjack tables .
reviews.title: Great 3 day stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would definitely go back again should we ever be that way again. The only reason we did go there was because we were on our way to Hawaii and thought a couple of days somewhere on the way would be better than a long flight and time changes.
reviews.title: Very Nice

likes.disliked: — Would have liked a few more machines in the Casino

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Recently stayed 2 nights here. Had requested West Tower, but upon check-in, all they had was East Tower. It was a little more inconvenient, but we coped OK (have to take extra escalators and walk more to get to pool, main casino, etc.). Pool area was pretty disappointing (not many chairs, though we found 2 for us, and no ambience at all. Just concrete surrounding plain pool with no view. Room was OK - no fridge or coffeemaker as others have said. Staff was nice enough and let us check out 1 hour later.
reviews.title: Average stay in nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Frequent travelers but never visit casino hotels - recently took my Mom for a 3 day stay in Reno. Selected Harrahs ($90 per room per night) based on Tripadviser - (many hotels were far cheaper), and were very satisfied! Rooms (West Tower) were completely updated, 16th floor had great views, service staff throughout were amazingly friendly and helpful. Casino was clean, restaurants and Starbucks handy and tasty. Italian restaurant was good but pricey for the area, more casual restaurant had American and Asian menus at very low prices and food was fine. Spa needs updating badly (men get treatments in women's locker room area?) and at $90 for massage is too high for facilities and area. Nevada museum within 5 block walking distance - well worth it! Car museum 2 blocks (hubby says best of the many he has seen) River Walk 1 block away and a very pleasant stroll. Overall a remarkably good stay.
reviews.title: Remarkably attractive and comfortable

reviews.text: A friend had some comps for this hotel, and booked it for us. I was very "underwhelmed" by a hotel that has such a great reputation. From the smell of stale, embedded smoke in the closet of a non-smoking room to the low water pressure in the shower to the $5 charge to use the exercise room, I think this is highly overrated. The outdoor pool is on a roof where the west tower blocks the sun for a good part of the day, and there is no outdoor jacuzzi or spa. If you want a jacuzzi experience, pay the $5 for the health club and use a jetted tub.
reviews.title: Good thing it was free!

reviews.text: The carpet had some spots on it. There is a serious lack of outlets in the room, and no amenities such as microwave, mini-frig, etc. It's obvious their main focus is to get you into their casino!
reviews.title: Good enough

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the plus side, the bed was very comfortable and I could adjust the room temperature pretty easily. It was quiet on the 11th floor, other than noisy neighbors in the corridor one night. They charge a daily fee for internet access (which Super 8 doesn't!!) but as I had my aircard, I didn't use it.
reviews.title: Glad I tried Reno

reviews.text: Harrah's rooms are what you would expect to find in a casino. They are clean and a good value. We were surprised that the king room in the tower we had reserved and later confirmed was not available at check in. We were given two double beds in another tower. Harrah's does not guarantee room or tower preferences. Rooms are assigned at check in so try to arrive early.
reviews.title: Harrah's Reno

reviews.text: Stayed at Harrah's Reno on a comp room offer for two weeknights via Harrah's Total Rewards players club (earned points in Vegas & Tahoe). Airport shuttle was timely, Front Desk granted a late checkout (1pm) during check-in without a hassle. East Tower room was clean and functional...neighbors' conversations could be heard through the walls after 2am (typical for a casino hotel)....Breakfast buffet was forgetable, had a good late-night burger at Cafe Napa, despite surly waiter (blew off my request for a bottle of ketchup--I had to walk into the back room to ask the beverage server).
reviews.title: Decent hotel, declining town.

likes.disliked: — Reno is in a sad decline.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Indian casinos in California have taken a major toll on Reno....all the downtown casinos were essentially dead during the weekday mornings--never seen business that slow (first trip to Reno was '93). Several of the downtown hotels have converted to apartments and condos...Downtown Reno is the last place I'd want to live; it's rundown and gloomy. I took a cab across town to the Peppermill, which was more lively (i.e., younger crowd) than the downtown casinos.
reviews.title: Great service, tiny bathroom - West Tower

likes.liked: — The great service. The location, too.

reviews.text: I stayed here because of the free room, but probably wouldn't pay to go back again...especially if I could choose Vegas or Tahoe. Reno is just too depressing.
reviews.title: Attention coffee lovers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were promptly waited on by the valet, registration desk, and bellmen. Everyone was most helpful and courteous. We stayed on the 13th floor of the West Tower. Maybe staying the previous week at Harrah's in South Lake Tahoe spoiled us. The bathroom was more than tiny. The rest of the room was average. Yes, there was a coffee maker in the room. The HVAC system utilizes a continuous fan.
reviews.title: We enjoyed our stay
